1.examplesEn:
As a bridesmaid, you can lower the cost significantly
by going for a bridesmaid dress rental service.
1.des:
{id:1338,create_time:"2015-03-17 11:48:03",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"As a bridesmaid, you can lower the cost significantly
by going for a bridesmaid dress rental service.",Examples_zh:"伴娘可以通过伴娘服租赁服务省不少钱。",annotation:"n. 租赁服务",ori_img_id:8058487166593284918}
1.examplesZh: 伴娘可以通过伴娘服租赁服务省不少钱。

2.examplesEn:
Many distressed teenagers seek solace in alcohol
or drugs after a fight with parents or friends.
2.trans: n. 安慰；慰藉；安慰之物
2.des:
{id:1336,create_time:"2015-03-12 15:43:29",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['sɒlɪs]",Examples_en:"Many distressed teenagers seek solace in alcohol
or drugs after a fight with parents or friends.",Examples_zh:"许多痛苦的青少年在与家人朋友争吵后，会从酒精和毒品中寻求慰藉。",annotation:"n. 安慰；慰藉；安慰之物",ori_img_id:3791947909316358448}
2.examplesZh: 许多痛苦的青少年在与家人朋友争吵后，会从酒精和毒品中寻求慰藉。

3.examplesEn:
A fresh, beautifully done manicure helps you look
attractive. But professional manicures can be expensive.
3.des:
{id:1335,create_time:"2015-03-12 15:26:27",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['mænɪkjʊə] ",Examples_en:"A fresh, beautifully done manicure helps you look
attractive. But professional manicures can be expensive.",Examples_zh:"清新美丽的美甲会让你看起来动人，但专业美甲有点贵。",annotation:"n.美甲，修指甲",ori_img_id:-5167207252920566900}
3.examplesZh: 清新美丽的美甲会让你看起来动人，但专业美甲有点贵。

4.examplesEn:
Although it can be unnerving to see, sleepwalking
is actually very common in kids.
4.des:
{id:1334,create_time:"2015-03-12 15:32:24",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['sliːp,wɔːkɪŋ]",Examples_en:"Although it can be unnerving to see, sleepwalking
is actually very common in kids. ",Examples_zh:"尽管有点吓人，但很多孩子都会出现梦游的情况。",annotation:"n. 梦游",ori_img_id:5357578992294033707}
4.examplesZh: 尽管有点吓人，但很多孩子都会出现梦游的情况。

5.examplesEn:
Cate Blanchett taps into her sinister side as she's
transformed into the wicked stepmother in the newly
released poster for Disney's Cinderella.
5.trans: adj.邪恶的；恶劣的；不道德的；顽皮的
5.des:
{id:1333,create_time:"2015-03-12 15:23:22",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['wɪkɪd]",Examples_en:"Cate Blanchett taps into her sinister side as she's
transformed into the wicked stepmother in the newly
released poster for Disney's Cinderella.",Examples_zh:"凯特挖掘自己的邪恶潜质，在迪士尼新片《灰姑娘》里转型成为恶毒继母。",annotation:"adj.邪恶的；恶劣的；不道德的；顽皮的",ori_img_id:9112893278962770130}
5.examplesZh: 凯特挖掘自己的邪恶潜质，在迪士尼新片《灰姑娘》里转型成为恶毒继母。

6.examplesEn: A new trailer for the highly-anticipated Fifty Shadesof Grey debuted on January 11.
6.des: {id:0,create_time:"",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['treɪlə]",Examples_en:"A new trailer for the highly-anticipated Fifty Shadesof Grey debuted on January 11. ",Examples_zh:"备受期待的《五十度灰》新预告片已于1月11日首映。",annotation:"n.预告片",ori_img_id:0}
6.examplesZh: 备受期待的《五十度灰》新预告片已于1月11日首映。

7.examplesEn:
Good conversation starters put people at ease
immediately.
7.des:
{id:1331,create_time:"2015-03-10 14:48:26",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"Good conversation starters put people at ease
immediately.",Examples_zh:"好的开场白会很快令人放松下来。",annotation:"n. 开场白",ori_img_id:3796223172281508389}
7.examplesZh: 好的开场白会很快令人放松下来。

8.examplesEn:
Such high housing prices have rendered me
a mortgage slave.
8.des:
{id:1330,create_time:"2015-03-10 14:53:23",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"Such high housing prices have rendered me
a mortgage slave.",Examples_zh:"这么高的房价已让我沦为房奴。",annotation:"n. 房奴",ori_img_id:2509723438429777145}
8.examplesZh: 这么高的房价已让我沦为房奴。

9.examplesEn:
Celebrity drug addiction is the top trending topic on
China's Twitter equivalent, Sina Weibo.
9.des:
{id:1329,create_time:"2015-03-10 14:03:17",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"Celebrity drug addiction is the top trending topic on
China's Twitter equivalent, Sina Weibo.",Examples_zh:"明星吸毒是当前微博最热门话题。",annotation:"热门话题",ori_img_id:-4389006974242134653}
9.examplesZh: 明星吸毒是当前微博最热门话题。

10.examplesEn: I don't want to be anyone's second choice.
10.des: {id:1326,create_time:"2015-03-05 15:52:12",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"I don't want to be anyone's second choice. ",Examples_zh:"我不想做任何人的备胎。",annotation:"备胎；备选",ori_img_id:923645596765518784}
10.examplesZh: 我不想做任何人的备胎。

11.examplesEn: Pick up lines might get you into trouble.
11.des: {id:0,create_time:"",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"Pick up lines might get you into trouble.",Examples_zh:"搭讪可能会让你惹祸上身。",annotation:"搭讪语",ori_img_id:0}
11.examplesZh: 搭讪可能会让你惹祸上身。

12.examplesEn: A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous.
12.des: {id:1323,create_time:"2015-03-05 15:56:05",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['klɑːsɪ]",Examples_en:"A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous.",Examples_zh:"一个女孩应该既有品位，又光彩照人。",annotation:"adj.有品位的，优等的",ori_img_id:6614761736710498686}
12.examplesZh: 一个女孩应该既有品位，又光彩照人。

13.examplesEn:
The 19 year-old was cyberstalked after her intense remark
got replied.
13.des:
{id:1328,create_time:"2015-03-06 18:44:58",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"The 19 year-old was cyberstalked after her intense remark
got replied.",Examples_zh:"陈赫回复评论后，这个19岁的女孩被人肉了。",annotation:" 人肉；网上跟踪",ori_img_id:2646046617104224907}
13.examplesZh: 陈赫回复评论后，这个19岁的女孩被人肉了。

14.examplesEn:
Some believe that Benedict Cumberbatch and Sophie Hunter
had a shotgun wedding.
14.des:
{id:1327,create_time:"2015-03-06 18:50:56",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:" ",Examples_en:"Some believe that Benedict Cumberbatch and Sophie Hunter
had a shotgun wedding.",Examples_zh:"有人认为卷福和苏菲是奉子成婚。",annotation:"奉子成婚",ori_img_id:-6150231119786151370}
14.examplesZh: 有人认为卷福和苏菲是奉子成婚。

15.examplesEn:
Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth 
until the hour of separation.
15.des:
{id:1321,create_time:"2015-03-02 15:54:44",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[sepə'reɪʃ(ə)n]",Examples_en:"Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth
until the hour of separation. ",Examples_zh:"从来都是别离时，才知爱有多深。",annotation:"n. 分离",ori_img_id:-7741826192418711763}
15.examplesZh: 从来都是别离时，才知爱有多深。

17.examplesEn:
...they can add special effects afterwards, and the hair 
will be like “DUANG”!So rich! So shiny! So soft!
17.des:
{id:1320,create_time:"2015-03-02 15:38:40",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['speʃ(ə)l-ɪ'fekt]",Examples_en:"...they can add special effects afterwards, and the hair
will be like “DUANG”!So rich! So shiny! So soft!",Examples_zh:"......他们拍完（广告）可以加特技，然后DUANG~~我的头发乌黑浓密又闪亮！",annotation:"n. 特效",ori_img_id:4061033826143266556}
17.examplesZh: ......他们拍完（广告）可以加特技，然后DUANG~~我的头发乌黑浓密又闪亮！

16.examplesEn: A stream flowed gently down into the valley.
16.des: {id:0,create_time:"",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[fləʊ]",Examples_en:"A stream flowed gently down into the valley.",Examples_zh:"一条小溪缓缓地流进山谷。",annotation:"v. 流动",ori_img_id:0}
16.examplesZh: 一条小溪缓缓地流进山谷。

19.examplesEn:
Chai Jing's "Under the Dome" sounds environmental 
alarm bell.
19.des:
{id:1319,create_time:"2015-03-02 15:32:39",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[dəʊm]",Examples_en:"Chai Jing's \"Under the Dome\" sounds environmental
alarm bell.",Examples_zh:"柴静的《苍穹之下》敲响了环保的警钟。",annotation:"n. 圆屋顶",ori_img_id:689890336506415331}
19.examplesZh: 柴静的《苍穹之下》敲响了环保的警钟。

18.examplesEn:
Some talents are with us since the day we were born, others 
become obvious only after many years of mastery.
18.des:
{id:1316,create_time:"2015-02-02 15:27:19",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['mɑːst(ə)rɪ]",Examples_en:"Some talents are with us since the day we were born, others
become obvious only after many years of mastery.",Examples_zh:"有的才能是生来就有的，有的则是需要多年的训练之后精通了才表现出来。",annotation:"n. 精通",ori_img_id:-3759779656081161427}
18.examplesZh: 有的才能是生来就有的，有的则是需要多年的训练之后精通了才表现出来。

21.examplesEn: The internet is having a meltdown over the color of a dress.
21.trans: n. (公司、机构、系统等的) 突然崩溃
21.des: {id:1318,create_time:"2015-03-02 15:03:38",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['meltdaʊn]",Examples_en:"The internet is having a meltdown over the color of a dress.",Examples_zh:"因为一条裙子的颜色，互联网崩溃了。",annotation:"n. (公司、机构、系统等的) 突然崩溃",ori_img_id:6451115049488924783}
21.examplesZh: 因为一条裙子的颜色，互联网崩溃了。

20.examplesEn: A sailing boat is propelled by wind.
20.des: {id:1314,create_time:"2015-02-02 14:13:55",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[prə'pel]",Examples_en:"A sailing boat is propelled by wind.",Examples_zh:"帆船是由风力推进的。",annotation:"v. 推动；推进：",ori_img_id:-8363196639743729454}

23.examplesEn:
Any stress or sudden change in her life at one time would 
send her into a tailspin psychologically.
23.des:
{id:1313,create_time:"2015-02-02 14:40:25",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['teɪlspɪn]",Examples_en:"Any stress or sudden change in her life at one time would
send her into a tailspin psychologically. ",Examples_zh:"她生活中的任何压力和突变都会使她送入心理上的混乱。",annotation:"n. 混乱",ori_img_id:-7279837754791177429}
23.examplesZh: 她生活中的任何压力和突变都会使她送入心理上的混乱。

22.examplesEn:
Perhaps the only thing more prevalent than colds is the 
volume of misinformation about them.
22.des:
{id:1315,create_time:"2015-02-02 15:15:05",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['prev(ə)l(ə)nt]",Examples_en:"Perhaps the only thing more prevalent than colds is the
volume of misinformation about them.",Examples_zh:"可能唯一比感冒更为流行的就是对它本身误解的声音了。",annotation:"adj. 流行的",ori_img_id:7898182259951146269}
22.examplesZh: 可能唯一比感冒更为流行的就是对它本身误解的声音了。

25.examplesEn:
On the vast fields, one sees nothing but the wheat billowing 
in the wind.
25.des:
{id:1311,create_time:"2015-02-02 13:43:51",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[vɑːst]",Examples_en:"On the vast fields, one sees nothing but the wheat billowing
in the wind. ",Examples_zh:"在辽阔的原野上，但见麦浪随风起伏。",annotation:"adj. 辽阔的",ori_img_id:3159839558841103564}
25.examplesZh: 在辽阔的原野上，但见麦浪随风起伏。

24.examplesEn:
The poor ballet dancer must devote years of incessant toil 
to her profitless task before she can shine in it.
24.des:
{id:1312,create_time:"2015-02-02 14:19:08",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[tɒɪl]",Examples_en:"The poor ballet dancer must devote years of incessant toil
to her profitless task before she can shine in it.",Examples_zh:"可怜的芭蕾舞演员要把多年不断的辛劳献给她无益的苦差事，之后她才能在芭蕾上大放异彩。",annotation:"n. 辛苦；苦工",ori_img_id:7576528915226038583}
24.examplesZh: 可怜的芭蕾舞演员要把多年不断的辛劳献给她无益的苦差事，之后她才能在芭蕾上大放异彩。

27.examplesEn: A dropped cigarette may have sparked the fire.
27.des: {id:1309,create_time:"2015-02-02 11:17:32",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[spɑːk]",Examples_en:"A dropped cigarette may have sparked the fire.",Examples_zh:"一支丢弃的香烟可能引发了这场火灾。",annotation:"n. 引发",ori_img_id:-7395849963066936463}
27.examplesZh: 一支丢弃的香烟可能引发了这场火灾。

26.examplesEn: He must suppress his feelings beneath his calm surface.
26.des: {id:0,create_time:"",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[sə'pres]",Examples_en:"He must suppress his feelings beneath his calm surface.",Examples_zh:"他必须抑制平静的外表下面的感情。",annotation:"v. 抑制",ori_img_id:0}
26.examplesZh: 他必须抑制平静的外表下面的感情。

29.examplesEn: Marriage ages have risen all over the world, but the increase is particularly marked in Asia.
29.des: {id:0,create_time:"",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[mɑːkt]",Examples_en:"Marriage ages have risen all over the world, but the increase is particularly marked in Asia.",Examples_zh:"结婚年龄在世界范围内都有上升，但是这种增长在亚洲尤为明显。",annotation:"adj. 显著的",ori_img_id:0}
29.examplesZh: 结婚年龄在世界范围内都有上升，但是这种增长在亚洲尤为明显。

28.examplesEn:
During the evening walk, I'm able to think about my victories 
and clear away any residual negativity.
28.des:
{id:1308,create_time:"2015-02-02 11:28:07",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[rɪ'zɪdjʊəl]",Examples_en:"During the evening walk, I'm able to think about my victories
and clear away any residual negativity.",Examples_zh:"在晚上的散步中，我能够想想我的战果，清除那些剩余的消极性。",annotation:"adj. 剩余的",ori_img_id:-6958689499141128474}
28.examplesZh: 在晚上的散步中，我能够想想我的战果，清除那些剩余的消极性。

31.examplesEn: She exudes an air of relaxed calm.
31.des: {id:1305,create_time:"2015-01-30 16:54:01",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[ɪg'zjuːd]",Examples_en:"She exudes an air of relaxed calm.",Examples_zh:"她洋溢着一副从容平静的神情。",annotation:"v. 洋溢",ori_img_id:-8932289301561637361}
31.examplesZh: 她洋溢着一副从容平静的神情。

30.examplesEn: Life is better enjoyed at a leisurely pace.
30.des: {id:1306,create_time:"2015-01-30 16:23:17",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['leʒəlɪ]",Examples_en:"Life is better enjoyed at a leisurely pace. ",Examples_zh:"生活以一种悠闲的步调来享受感觉更好。",annotation:"adj. 悠闲的",ori_img_id:-3474166701551025365}
30.examplesZh: 生活以一种悠闲的步调来享受感觉更好。

34.examplesEn: She added only a hint of vermouth to the gin.
34.des: {id:1302,create_time:"2015-01-30 14:15:12",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[hɪnt]",Examples_en:"She added only a hint of vermouth to the gin.",Examples_zh:"她往杜松子酒里只加了一点儿苦艾酒。",annotation:"n. 微量",ori_img_id:-1623195870875590993}
34.examplesZh: 她往杜松子酒里只加了一点儿苦艾酒。

35.examplesEn:
Apply shampoo at the nape of the neck and shampoo the 
hairline first, followed by the top of your head.
35.des:
{id:1301,create_time:"2015-01-30 13:49:50",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['heəlaɪn]",Examples_en:"Apply shampoo at the nape of the neck and shampoo the
hairline first, followed by the top of your head.",Examples_zh:"把洗发水抹在颈背上，先洗发际线上的头发，然后才洗头顶的部分。",annotation:"n. 发际线",ori_img_id:69374704947020687}
35.examplesZh: 把洗发水抹在颈背上，先洗发际线上的头发，然后才洗头顶的部分。

32.examplesEn: The key to success is to be ready from the start.

32.examplesZh: 成功的关键是从一开始就做好准备。

33.examplesEn: The clouds indicate the coming of rain.

33.examplesZh: 云彩预示着即将下雨了。

39.examplesEn:
Please do not accuse me of presumption if I yield to this 
impulse of love.

39.examplesZh: 如果我屈服于这爱的冲动，请不要谴责我的放肆。

37.examplesEn:
Colleges are not always geared to the needs of mature 
students.

students.",Examples_zh:"大学并不总是去适应成年学生的需要。",annotation:"v. 使适合",ori_img_id:8103335009939413422}
37.examplesZh: 大学并不总是去适应成年学生的需要。

42.examplesEn: She tried hard to retrieve her luxurious life.
42.des: {id:1294,create_time:"2015-01-29 16:00:28",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[rɪ'triːv]",Examples_en:"She tried hard to retrieve her luxurious life.",Examples_zh:"她极力设法恢复她的奢华生活。",annotation:"v. 恢复",ori_img_id:-4767140454653789068}
42.examplesZh: 她极力设法恢复她的奢华生活。

43.examplesEn:
Do not speak to a fool, for he will scorn the wisdom of your 
words.
43.des:
{id:1293,create_time:"2015-01-29 16:42:12",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[skɔːn]",Examples_en:"Do not speak to a fool, for he will scorn the wisdom of your
words. ",Examples_zh:"不要跟愚昧的人说话，因他必藐视你智慧的言语。",annotation:"v. 藐视",ori_img_id:3992909986544267658}
43.examplesZh: 不要跟愚昧的人说话，因他必藐视你智慧的言语。

40.examplesEn: She was attacked by a man wielding a knife.
40.des: {id:1296,create_time:"2015-01-29 16:52:45",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[wiːld]",Examples_en:"She was attacked by a man wielding a knife.",Examples_zh:"她遭到一名持刀男子的袭击。",annotation:"v. 拿着 (武器）",ori_img_id:8647190425327494762}
40.examplesZh: 她遭到一名持刀男子的袭击。

41.examplesEn:
The sleet began to taper off, and silence returned like a lost 
friend.
41.des:
{id:1295,create_time:"2015-01-29 16:15:39",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['teɪpə]",Examples_en:"The sleet began to taper off, and silence returned like a lost
friend.",Examples_zh:"冰雹开始减弱，寂静像失去的朋友再度归来。",annotation:"v. 逐渐变弱",ori_img_id:-8292545920433697924}
41.examplesZh: 冰雹开始减弱，寂静像失去的朋友再度归来。

46.examplesEn:
I went out for dinner last night and drank copious amounts 
of red wine.
46.des:
{id:1290,create_time:"2015-01-28 14:45:52",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['kəʊpɪəs]",Examples_en:"I went out for dinner last night and drank copious amounts
of red wine.",Examples_zh:"昨晚我出去吃饭，喝了许多红酒。",annotation:"adj. 很多的",ori_img_id:-1501124815100604183}
46.examplesZh: 昨晚我出去吃饭，喝了许多红酒。

47.examplesEn: We must confront future with optimism.

47.examplesZh: 我们必须乐观地面对未来。

44.examplesEn: Our teacher is so rigorous that he seldom lets up on us.

45.examplesEn: Shriley did her best to efface herself at parties.

51.examplesEn:
Breadfruit has long been a staple in Pacific islands, from 
where it spread to the Caribbean and Africa.

{id:1285,create_time:"2015-01-21 14:29:41",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['steɪp(ə)l]",Examples_en:"Breadfruit has long been a staple in Pacific islands, from
where it spread to the Caribbean and Africa.",Examples_zh:"长期以来，面包果一直是太平洋岛屿上的主食，并从那里传播到了加勒比海和非洲。",annotation:"n. 主食",ori_img_id:7346737135509324513}
51.examplesZh: 长期以来，面包果一直是太平洋岛屿上的主食，并从那里传播到了加勒比海和非洲。

50.examplesEn: For those with chronic depression, she said, "keep at it.
50.des: {id:1287,create_time:"2015-01-28 14:26:31",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['krɒnɪk]",Examples_en:"For those with chronic depression, she said, \"keep at it.",Examples_zh:"对于那些长期受抑郁困扰的患者，她说：“坚持！”",annotation:"adj. 长期的",ori_img_id:-3537030977369372617}
50.examplesZh: 对于那些长期受抑郁困扰的患者，她说：“坚持！”

49.examplesEn: We live in a compact neighborhood.
49.des: {id:1286,create_time:"2015-01-28 14:47:20",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[kəm'pækt]",Examples_en:"We live in a compact neighborhood. ",Examples_zh:"我们生活在一个紧凑的小区。",annotation:"adj. 紧凑的",ori_img_id:2102250865467220853}
49.examplesZh: 我们生活在一个紧凑的小区。

48.examplesEn:
Each of us needs to consume at least 5 liters of water per day, 
and everything we eat and drink contains water.
48.des:
{id:1288,create_time:"2015-01-28 14:57:37",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[kən'sjuːm]",Examples_en:"Each of us needs to consume at least 5 liters of water per day,
and everything we eat and drink contains water.",Examples_zh:"我们每人每天至少消耗5升的水，我们所吃所饮的一切东西也都包含着水。",annotation:"v. 消耗",ori_img_id:1869429083050771573}
48.examplesZh: 我们每人每天至少消耗5升的水，我们所吃所饮的一切东西也都包含着水。

55.examplesEn: Bamboo is light because it is hollow.
55.des: {id:1281,create_time:"2015-01-21 11:58:24",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['hɒləʊ]",Examples_en:"Bamboo is light because it is hollow.",Examples_zh:"竹子很轻， 因为它中间是空的。",annotation:"adj.中空的",ori_img_id:5929015903037908978}
55.examplesZh: 竹子很轻， 因为它中间是空的。

54.examplesEn:
Even the most mundane occurrences can have an impact on 
our awareness.

{id:1282,create_time:"2015-01-21 11:12:39",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['mʌndeɪn]",Examples_en:"Even the most mundane occurrences can have an impact on
our awareness. ",Examples_zh:"即使是最平凡的事情也能影响我们的感知。",annotation:"adj.平凡的",ori_img_id:-6910617786170772485}
54.examplesZh: 即使是最平凡的事情也能影响我们的感知。

53.examplesEn: The skier floated down the slope like a bird.
53.des: {id:1283,create_time:"2015-01-21 14:26:04",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[sləʊp]",Examples_en:"The skier floated down the slope like a bird.",Examples_zh:"滑雪者滑下斜坡，飘逸得像一只鸟。",annotation:"n. 斜坡",ori_img_id:-2772534812144605703}
53.examplesZh: 滑雪者滑下斜坡，飘逸得像一只鸟。

52.examplesEn:
As you surmise, the costs of the junk-food strategy are mostly 
long-term: the children become fat, their teeth rot and they 
refuse to eat more wholesome fare.
52.des:
{id:1284,create_time:"2015-01-21 14:07:18",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[sə'maɪz]",Examples_en:"As you surmise, the costs of the junk-food strategy are mostly
long-term: the children become fat, their teeth rot and they
refuse to eat more wholesome fare.",Examples_zh:"就像你猜测的那样：垃圾食物策略的代价是相当长期的，孩子们变胖，他们会有蛀牙，他们会拒绝再吃营养全面的食物。",annotation:"v. 猜测",ori_img_id:9087609994190212705}
52.examplesZh: 就像你猜测的那样：垃圾食物策略的代价是相当长期的，孩子们变胖，他们会有蛀牙，他们会拒绝再吃营养全面的食物。

59.examplesEn:
She almost started to fall from the balance beam but 
recovered herself in time.
59.des:
{id:1277,create_time:"2015-01-19 11:20:21",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[rɪ'kʌvə]",Examples_en:"She almost started to fall from the balance beam but
recovered herself in time.",Examples_zh:"她几乎从平衡木上掉了下来，但及时恢复了平衡。",annotation:"v.恢复",ori_img_id:8134025649752302019}
59.examplesZh: 她几乎从平衡木上掉了下来，但及时恢复了平衡。

58.examplesEn: Before the end of the race, she lapped the other runners.
58.des: {id:1278,create_time:"2015-01-19 11:49:42",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[læp]",Examples_en:"Before the end of the race, she lapped the other runners.",Examples_zh:"赛跑结束前，她比其他赛跑者领先了一圈。",annotation:"v.比…领先一圈",ori_img_id:5630158953486177952}
58.examplesZh: 赛跑结束前，她比其他赛跑者领先了一圈。

57.examplesEn:
The family linger away the whole summer vacation at a 
pleasure resort.

57.examplesZh: 这家人在一处游乐胜地消磨了整个暑假。

56.examplesEn: After a long drive we finally hauled into town at dusk.
56.des: {id:1280,create_time:"2015-01-21 11:33:12",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[hɔːl]",Examples_en:"After a long drive we finally hauled into town at dusk.",Examples_zh:"开车走了很长时间，在黄昏时终于到达城里。",annotation:"v.(费力地)到达某地",ori_img_id:-1946369117675326793}
56.examplesZh: 开车走了很长时间，在黄昏时终于到达城里。

63.examplesEn:
If your flight crew tells you to be seated because of 
turbulence， I highly recommend you heed their warning.
63.des:
{id:1272,create_time:"2015-01-12 17:47:25",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[hiːd]",Examples_en:"If your flight crew tells you to be seated because of
turbulence， I highly recommend you heed their warning. ",Examples_zh:"如果空勤人员告诉你前方有气流，请回到座位上并系好安全带，我强烈建议你还是听从他们的警告。",annotation:"v.留心",ori_img_id:-593444178240796396}
63.examplesZh: 如果空勤人员告诉你前方有气流，请回到座位上并系好安全带，我强烈建议你还是听从他们的警告。

62.examplesEn:
Missing deadlines is not only unprofessional; it can play havoc 
with others' schedules and make your boss look bad.

with others' schedules and make your boss look bad.",Examples_zh:"错过最后期限不仅不专业；也会严重破坏别人的日程安排并让你老板脸色难看。",annotation:"n.大破坏",ori_img_id:-8412834263697329821}
62.examplesZh: 错过最后期限不仅不专业；也会严重破坏别人的日程安排并让你老板脸色难看。

60.examplesEn:

70.examplesEn:
We were just having our lunch when he spotted it 
camouflaged under a pile of leaves.

{id:1265,create_time:"2015-01-08 16:22:02",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['kæməflɑːʒ]",Examples_en:"We were just having our lunch when he spotted it
camouflaged under a pile of leaves.",Examples_zh:"当他发现它隐藏在一堆落叶下面的时候，我们正在吃午餐。",annotation:"v.伪装",ori_img_id:-7076759109090118815}
70.examplesZh: 当他发现它隐藏在一堆落叶下面的时候，我们正在吃午餐。

71.examplesEn:
Moths survive by being camouflaged, and ladybugs survive 
by being conspicuous and telling birds not to eat them.
71.des:
{id:1264,create_time:"2015-01-08 15:42:45",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[kən'spɪkjʊəs]",Examples_en:"Moths survive by being camouflaged, and ladybugs survive
by being conspicuous and telling birds not to eat them.",Examples_zh:"然而飞蛾通过伪装自己生存，瓢虫却通过引人注目来告诉鸟类不要吃他们。",annotation:"adj.引人注目的",ori_img_id:-5507902271349020951}
71.examplesZh: 然而飞蛾通过伪装自己生存，瓢虫却通过引人注目来告诉鸟类不要吃他们。

64.examplesEn: Allow extra time for everything. Don't be hasty.

64.examplesZh: 要给所有的事足够的时间，不要太匆忙。

66.examplesZh: 风把很多树的叶子都吹落了。

or eating patterns.

tough.

87.examplesEn:
According to Oxford University scientists, every time we 
start a relationship we jettison two of our closest friends.

87.examplesZh: 按照牛津大学科学家的说法，我们每开始一段感情，就会抛弃两位最亲密的朋友。

or abuse.

83.examplesEn: If you can't cook, then solicit the help of someone who can.

82.examplesEn:
Instead of seeing the setback as something discouraging, 
just accept it as a part of the journey.

just accept it as a part of the journey.",Examples_zh:"把挫折看做是你人生旅途的一部分，而不是把它视作为令人沮丧的东西。",annotation:"n. 挫折",ori_img_id:-9181678532555153239}
82.examplesZh: 把挫折看做是你人生旅途的一部分，而不是把它视作为令人沮丧的东西。

93.examplesEn: Indians were the indigenous inhabitants of America.
93.des: {id:1241,create_time:"2014-12-12 14:50:43",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[ɪn'dɪdʒɪnəs]",Examples_en:"Indians were the indigenous inhabitants of America.",Examples_zh:"印第安人是美洲的土著居民。",annotation:"adj. 本土的；土著的",ori_img_id:8121642671648046012}
93.examplesZh: 印第安人是美洲的土著居民。

92.examplesEn:
This mentalist yearn easily trigger a large-scale consumption 
campaign.

campaign.",Examples_zh:"这种心态容易引发一场大规模消费高潮。",annotation:"v. 引发，触发",ori_img_id:-395901747986076578}
92.examplesZh: 这种心态容易引发一场大规模消费高潮。

95.examplesEn:
Herbs have been used for centuries to endow a whole range 
of foods with subtle flavours.
95.des:
{id:1239,create_time:"2014-12-12 14:24:26",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[ɪn'daʊ]",Examples_en:"Herbs have been used for centuries to endow a whole range
of foods with subtle flavours.",Examples_zh:"香草几个世纪以来一直被用来赋予各种食品细腻的味道。",annotation:"v. 赋予",ori_img_id:4320810382896548698}
95.examplesZh: 香草几个世纪以来一直被用来赋予各种食品细腻的味道。

94.examplesEn:
A new report suggests that chewing gum may be a health 
hazard.
94.des:
{id:1240,create_time:"2014-12-12 14:25:34",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['hæzəd]",Examples_en:"A new report suggests that chewing gum may be a health
hazard.",Examples_zh:"一份新的报告指出，嚼口香糖可能给健康带来危害。",annotation:"n. 危险",ori_img_id:9190949887202365665}
94.examplesZh: 一份新的报告指出，嚼口香糖可能给健康带来危害。

89.examplesEn:
For some people, a mosquito in the room is a threat to any 
little patch of exposed skin, while others seem to go unscathed.
89.des:
{id:1245,create_time:"2014-12-19 10:22:59",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[pætʃ] ",Examples_en:"For some people, a mosquito in the room is a threat to any
little patch of exposed skin, while others seem to go unscathed.",Examples_zh:"对于一些人来说，只要暴露一小块皮肤，房间里的蚊子就会给他们带来威胁，而另外一些人好象安然无恙。",annotation:"n.一小块",ori_img_id:-5823520633336372858}
89.examplesZh: 对于一些人来说，只要暴露一小块皮肤，房间里的蚊子就会给他们带来威胁，而另外一些人好象安然无恙。

88.examplesEn:
A medium-sized dog will devour at least one can of food 
plus biscuits per day.
88.des:
{id:1246,create_time:"2014-12-22 16:31:06",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[dɪ'vaʊə] ",Examples_en:"A medium-sized dog will devour at least one can of food
plus biscuits per day.",Examples_zh:"一只中等大小的狗每天至少要干掉一罐食物外加饼干。",annotation:"v.吞食",ori_img_id:-5287824129059141600}
88.examplesZh: 一只中等大小的狗每天至少要干掉一罐食物外加饼干。

91.examplesEn:
No one listens for that long if you speak with a monotone 
voice.
91.des:
{id:1242,create_time:"2014-12-12 14:00:54",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['mɒnətəʊn]",Examples_en:"No one listens for that long if you speak with a monotone
voice.",Examples_zh:"没有人愿意长时间的听不带任何感情的说话。",annotation:"adj. 单调的",ori_img_id:2531683400611450515}
91.examplesZh: 没有人愿意长时间的听不带任何感情的说话。

90.examplesEn:
The proposed new structure is notable not only for its height, 
but for its shape.
90.des:
{id:1244,create_time:"2014-12-19 10:16:50",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['nəʊtəb(ə)l]",Examples_en:"The proposed new structure is notable not only for its height,
but for its shape.",Examples_zh:"那座提议的新建筑值得注意，不仅因其高度，还因其外形。",annotation:"adj.值得注意的",ori_img_id:-1340979776599449651}
90.examplesZh: 那座提议的新建筑值得注意，不仅因其高度，还因其外形。

100.examplesEn: What prompted him to be so generous?
100.des: {id:1234,create_time:"2014-12-01 10:19:11",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[prɒm(p)t]",Examples_en:"What prompted him to be so generous?",Examples_zh:"是什么原因使得他如此大方呢?",annotation:"v.促进；激起",ori_img_id:-1177106849467131556}
100.examplesZh: 是什么原因使得他如此大方呢?

98.examplesEn: Their needs are pure sustenance, and their love and loyalty are without restraint.
98.des: {id:0,create_time:"",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"['sʌst(ə)nəns]",Examples_en:"Their needs are pure sustenance, and their love and loyalty are without restraint.",Examples_zh:"它们索取的只是维持生计的粮食，却献出了无限的爱和忠诚。",annotation:"n. 食物；生计",ori_img_id:0}
98.examplesZh: 它们索取的只是维持生计的粮食，却献出了无限的爱和忠诚。

99.examplesEn:
Instead of flying off the handle every time something bad 
happens, you could take it all in stride.
99.des:
{id:1235,create_time:"2014-12-01 10:40:27",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[straɪd]",Examples_en:"Instead of flying off the handle every time something bad
happens, you could take it all in stride. ",Examples_zh:"在糟糕的事情发生后，不必每一次都停下来处理它，你可以大步前进将其抛在脑后。",annotation:"n. 大步",ori_img_id:-2890379276751455321}
99.examplesZh: 在糟糕的事情发生后，不必每一次都停下来处理它，你可以大步前进将其抛在脑后。

96.examplesEn:
Do you have the courage to go after what you want with 
tenacity and see it through to the end?
96.des:
{id:1238,create_time:"2014-12-01 11:50:00",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[tɪ'næsɪtɪ]",Examples_en:"Do you have the courage to go after what you want with
tenacity and see it through to the end? ",Examples_zh:"你是否有勇气去追求你的梦想？ 并且能够坚韧不拔地走到最后。",annotation:"n. 韧性",ori_img_id:-1080790252137525946}
96.examplesZh: 你是否有勇气去追求你的梦想？ 并且能够坚韧不拔地走到最后。

97.examplesEn: It's hard to tame the wild horse.
97.des: {id:1237,create_time:"2014-12-01 10:14:54",remark:"",share:"",phonogram:"[teɪm]",Examples_en:"It's hard to tame the wild horse.",Examples_zh:"那匹野马很难驯服。",annotation:"v. 驯服",ori_img_id:3795727706346344113}
